snippet: Local councils in rebel-held towns are trying to set up courts, police forces and social services, amounting to Syria’s first experiments in self-government after years under the Assads.
abstract: Scores of new local councils in rebel-held Syrian towns like Tilalyan are trying to set up courts, police forces and social services, as two-year-old civil war shows signs of stalemate; councils' efforts amount to Syria's first experiments in self-government after decades of tyranny under Pres Bashar al-Assad and his father Hafez al-Assad.
lead_paragraph: Local councils in rebel-held towns are trying to set up courts, police forces and social services, amounting to Syria’s first experiments in self-government after years under the Assads.

headline.seo: Syrian Civilians Take Reins in Test of Self-Government
headline.main: Fighting Shortages, Syrian Civilians Take Reins in Rebel Areas
headline.print_headline: Syrian Civilians, Fighting Shortages, Take Reins in Rebel Areas
